turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Stu?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Julie?... Hey, you <u>are</u> a looker.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: How was it? I don't recall.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: It was great, baby. Let's get you to the ER.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Oh, Stu. Tell me I'm not dreaming.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Baby...you're asking the wrong guy.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: My <u>tail</u> itches.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: Oh, Julie...my poor Stu...my poor baby brother...

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: When'd you get in?

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: An hour ago. I tried to prepare myself, but I didn't know he would be like, like this. I can't even bear to look at him... How about you? You're okay?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I'm fine, Kimmy. Fine.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: I had so much I always wanted to say to him. At least he had a chance to give you the ring.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: The ring...

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: Grandmama's ring. The <u>engagement</u> ring. He asked me to send it to him -

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Kimmy, he doesn't know what's going on. He doesn't even know he's in a -

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: Please, Julie. This is not easy for me. Our father took a <u>long</u> time to die. A long time. It just about killed us all. And Stu and I made a pact that when our time came - we wouldn't let it drag out.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: It's too soon even to - <u>talk</u> about that!

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: Give me a date, Doctor.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Kimmy! What's the matter?

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: This is hard for me, Julie...very hard...but it's been three months now, and... I gave the order.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Nothing for him! He's being repressed.

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: Is something wrong, Stu? You seem so tense.

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: Hypnos?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Yeah. To see if he could expedite my case. But I wait, and I wait, and...I'm starting to think I'll never see her again.

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: I'm so sorry, Stu. I <u>wanted</u> to tell you what was going on. I really, really liked you.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Kitty...<u>my</u> situation is really not important. The thing is, my girlfriend is now living with, and possibly engaged to, a demented monkey.

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: You're such a beautiful man. Look at you - stuck in this place, and only thinking of her.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Listen to me! Is there any way I can <u>warn</u> her what Monkeybone is up to??

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: Don't ask where I got it.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: You can't do this! You'll get in trouble!

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: You're the only true-hearted man I ever met. You find a way back to that girl of yours and make her happy.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: How am I gonna get past the guards?

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: I'll worry about the guards. OKAY, STU. SEE YOU IN A DAY OR TWO.

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: Go. Just <u>go</u>.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Thanks, Kitty, I'll never forget you for th--

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: <u>You</u> have humiliated me in public for the <u>last</u> <u>time</u>.

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: I doubt that. Besides, I can't help myself. I'm just a figment of your imagination.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Then you can learn to act normally. I had to!

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: Aw, come on. You know you love me. You're a masochistic pain freak. You <u>gotta</u> love me.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I am not. And I don't gotta.

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: You are too! Mooning over Julie when we could <u>both</u> be gettin' some o' this fine local action. It's not like she's gonna know. Out of town, under five minutes, and in a coma don't <u>count</u>.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Sorry. The women here aren't my type. Most of them aren't even my <u>species</u>.

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: Aaah, it's the same as always...poor mope's just wishin' he was me.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I've been trying to get through to the head guy - the nightmare god - what's his name?

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: My Fellow Americans. I have a dream. Let us boldly go where no man has gone before.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I'm sorry, Kitty - what were you saying?

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: Come on, pal! It was a compliment! You'da done the same if you had the equipment!

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: THAT DOES IT! BACK IN THE PACK!

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: FORGET IT! NO WAY! I'M NOT GETTING -

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: I'm reportin' this to my union!!

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: <u>What</u> union?

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: The sidekicks' union! Me, Tonto, and Robin the Boy Wonder. You top bananas better <u>watch your</u> <u>ass</u>!

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: I left my phone number in your undies. Try not to lose it in traffic.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Sorry, Kitty! I'll be right back after I choke my monkey.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: He's ninety. He's practically dead already. How come <u>he</u> goes back and <u>I</u> stay here?

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: Maybe he wanted to pick out his own casket?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: HEY!! HEY, YOU!!

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: <u>He</u> got an E-ticket. Where's mine? <u>When do I get</u> <u>to wake up</u>??

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: Stu? Stu? Let's not disturb the nice Reaper.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I've been stuck down here for <u>months</u>. Somebody had better start paying attention, or I'm gonna - I'm gonna <u>kick ass</u>!

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: Let's not kick the nice Reaper's ass.

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: Y'call that art? Why, my three-year-old can paint better than that.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Like you'd know. You started out on the back of a napkin, you little...<u>doodle</u>.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: How'd <u>you</u> get in there?

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: Stu... It's a <u>party</u>.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Mr. Hypnos - sir - I needed to talk to you -

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: Pact? Pact? NO LIFE SUPPORT??

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Well - yeah - but that doesn't...<u>apply</u>. It was different then. I was <u>depressed</u>. My life is great now. I'm in love!

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: I'm so dumb! I <u>deserve</u> to die -

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Mr. Hypnos, you run this place. I'm begging you. There's gotta be something I can do.

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: Fate worse than death! Well, it's been real, boss, but I gotta go buff up my resumé. ANYBODY HERE NEED A FIGMENT?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Fine! Don't put yourself out. I'll go to the land of Death alone.

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: Stu, you have my <u>absolute confidence</u>. ­- DEAD MAN! DEAD MAN WALKING!!

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I've got one chance to get back to Julie, and I'm gonna take it - with or without you.

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: Hey. Aren't you gonna talk me into it?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: No. Goodbye. Thanks for nothing.

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: You gotta talk me into it. You'll screw up on your own. I mean, a guy's gotta have a sidekick. For moral support! Wisecracks - snappy banter - It's the land of Death, Stu, the Land of Death! Don't go in there without your comedy relief!!

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: All right. You can come.

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: OH, THANK YOU! THANK YOU! TH-- Something went very, very wrong here.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Now we just gotta figure out how to get there.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: He's taking her to the land of Death, right? So all we've gotta do is...hitch a ride! Stop shaking! I'll protect you.

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: Oh, <u>sure</u>. Mr. Action Hero! Why couldn't I be Arnold Schwarzenegger's figment?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Where'd he go??

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: I don't <u>know</u>.

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: Stu...Stu...

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: IT'S NOT WORKING.

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: There's a thing here! There's a switch!

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: Stu...LOOK!

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: Isn't that Lulu?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: You saved my life, Monkeybone. I never would've made it without you.

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: Move it. We got exactly five minutes left.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: It's just...now that I'm leaving, I feel like there's lots of things I haven't said. Who's gonna look out for you? Are you gonna be okay when I'm gone?

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: Oh, don't you worry. I'll be fine.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: You've been a hell of a figment, pal. I sure wish I could take you home with me.

turns.speaker: MONKEYBONE
turns.text: Awwww. Worried about my feelings, are you? Well, there's a new twist.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Don't joke around, little buddy. I mean it. I really do love y--

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Oh, please, don't hurt me.

turns.speaker: DISCIPLE PROSPECT
turns.text: I just need to use the phone, lady.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Oh, let me get out of your way then.

turns.speaker: DISCIPLE PROSPECT
turns.text: What happened?  Did you lose your keys?

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Have a nice day.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Excuse me, sir.  I just wanted to thank you for helping me get into my building yesterday.

turns.speaker: DISCIPLE PROSPECT
turns.text: Yeah, sure, no problem, you're welcome.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: My daughter lives across the street from you people and she tells me that you keep this area safe.  Is that true?

turns.speaker: DISCIPLE PROSPECT
turns.text: We like to think so, yeah.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: And you don't deal drugs?

turns.speaker: DISCIPLE PROSPECT
turns.text: Who told you we deal drugs?

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: I'm just concerned about my daughter.

turns.speaker: DISCIPLE PROSPECT
turns.text: You don't have to worry.  She's going to be fine.  We're law-abiding citizens just like you.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: What about yesterday?  Kicking that poor boy?

turns.speaker: DISCIPLE PROSPECT
turns.text: That poor boy's a crack dealer from Alphabet City.  We do not allow his kind on this block.

turns.speaker: DISCIPLE PROSPECT
turns.text: Is there something else I can do for you?

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Well, I'd love to see inside your club.

turns.speaker: DISCIPLE PROSPECT
turns.text: You want to come inside?

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Well, if you're not holding a meeting or anything.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: So, what do you think?

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Well, once you're inside, it's nice.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: You don't like where I live?

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Well, when I walked up the block, I ... well, my word!

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: That's New York.  It looks rundown, but it's safe during the day.  You'll get used to it.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: I wanted to ask you something.  Those motorcycles across the street ...?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Uh-huh?

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: ... What are they all doing there?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: That's the Satan's Disciples' New York headquarters.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: The motorcycle gang?  Don't they deal drugs and rape young girls?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: I've never had any problem with them. People say it's the safest block in the East Village.  I just hope their motorcycles don't keep you up at night.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: I just can't seem to focus on anything these days.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: That's why it's good you came to visit me.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: How are you doing sweetheart?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: I'm good.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Dating anyone?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: No, I'm working too much, I don't have time.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: What about the fellow in those pictures?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: What pictures?

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: You know ...  ... whoops!

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Mother!

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Well, they were right out in plain view.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Behind the books.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: But I was dusting.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: I was seeing Aaron and there were some ... complications.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: He seemed quite taken with you.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: I don't want to talk about it.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: You know, you never tell me anything.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: That's not true.  Besides, I don't want you dusting.  I want you to see New York.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Don, this is my mother.  Mom, this is my boss, Don Palmer.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Oh, it's so nice to meet you.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Mother, I ...

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: My daughter lives right across the street from the Satan's Disciples' clubhouse, and I was so worried about her ... so, I went over and introduced myself. And they were the nicest people.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Mom ... I mean, it's amusing to imagine such a thing, but ... how many of those pills have you been taking?

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Oh, that has nothing to do with it.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: No, no, it's my fault.  I've been pushing you too hard to do things on your own.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Mom, I need to talk to you.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: If it's about the bikers, dear, I don't want to talk about it.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: No, I had a dream about daddy.  Do you think I'll ever meet anyone like him?

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Oh, I hope so, dear.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: You know that guy in the pictures you saw?

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Aaron?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Yeah ... turned out to be a real jerk.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: It's unusually quiet tonight, isn't it?

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Mm hmm.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: I think you should consider coming out and staying with me longer.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Oh, I don't want to be in the way. You've got your career and everything.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: You wouldn't be in the way.  I like having you around.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Dear, I was thinking.  Why don't we go to Paris next year?  I've never been.  Your father, God bless him, wasn't much for traveling.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: I'd love to.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Here you go.  I think you should talk to Dr. Byrne when you get back about how much Valium he's prescribing.  Okay?

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: At my age, I'm going to take any pill that makes me feel better.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Mother!

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: I can make my own decisions.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: I love you, Mom.  I have to run.  You remembered to call the limousine service, right?

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Mm hmm.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Well, bye.  And have a safe trip ... and ... Paris in the spring!

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Goodbye, sweetheart.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: MARIKA
turns.text: It's Marika.  Is Paula there?

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: She's at work.  I'm her mother.

turns.speaker: MARIKA
turns.text: Oh.  I thought today was Saturday.

turns.speaker: MARIKA
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I had a wretched night.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Oh.  You need a cappuccino.

turns.speaker: MARIKA
turns.text: And there was this number on my phone bill that I didn't recognize.  Calls made at three and four in the morning.  So, I called the number ... and a woman answered.  And I ... I hung up.  So, then I followed him.  Just like in the movies.  And I found out that he has a wife and a little girl living in Brooklyn.  We had been going together for almost a year.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Men ... they're all the same.  Our pastor in Sioux Falls was caught with his wife's sister.

turns.speaker: MARIKA
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Oh, it was such a big scandal.

turns.speaker: MARIKA
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Poor man had to leave town.  And I hear that other women came forward.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: You know, you ought to come out to South Dakota some time and meet my son, Steve. He's single.

turns.speaker: MARIKA
turns.text: What does he do?

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: He's an organic farmer.

turns.speaker: MARIKA
turns.text: Oh.  Well, that would be a ... change.  Thank you, Mrs. Peterson.  You have a very reassuring voice.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: I wonder what they do in there?  Don't they frighten you?  They all look so ...

turns.speaker: MARIKA
turns.text: ... Manly?

turns.speaker: MISCHA
turns.text: Where to?

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Are you sure you got my bag in?

turns.speaker: MISCHA
turns.text: What do you think?  I left it on the curb?

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: I'm sorry, I'm a little nervous.  It's my first time in New York.  Just a minute.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: I came to New York to visit my youngest daughter.

turns.speaker: MISCHA
turns.text: And where is she?

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: She would have come to the airport to meet me - she wanted to - but ... but, she just started a new job and, well, I guess no one drives here.

turns.speaker: MISCHA
turns.text: So, you come here all by yourself?

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Uh, yes.  My husband passed away recently ...

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: ... And the children thought I should take a trip.

turns.speaker: MISCHA
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: I'm from South Dakota.  Where are you from?

turns.speaker: MISCHA
turns.text: Moscow.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Ohhh.  Do you know the East Village?

turns.speaker: MISCHA
turns.text: Oh, yeah ... yeah ... it's a hellhole.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: You mean it's dangerous?

turns.speaker: MISCHA
turns.text: Nah, not dangerous.  Not that dangerous.  Not during the day.

turns.speaker: MISCHA
turns.text: This is one-way street.  You go down the block to the middle.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: This way?

turns.speaker: MISCHA
turns.text: Yeah.  Not far.  You will be fine.  It's still day.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: I see.  How much?

turns.speaker: MISCHA
turns.text: Forty-five all total.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Forty-five?  I thought it was only supposed to be thirty?

turns.speaker: MISCHA
turns.text: Thirty is base price.  Tolls, tax, tip ... it all adds up.

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: Here you are, Senator. Not a bad desk, either. Daniel Webster used to use it.

turns.speaker: JEFFERSON
turns.text: Daniel Webster? Sat here? Say--that man was a great orator.

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: Give you something to shoot at, Senator--if you figure on doing any talking.

turns.speaker: JEFFERSON
turns.text: Not me, sonny. I'm just going to sit around and listen.  What's this?

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: Calendar for the day. You'll find the Senate Manual in the drawer. Anything else you want, just snap for a page.

turns.speaker: JEFFERSON
turns.text: Where's the Majority Leader?

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: The Majority Leader? Right over there. And that's [           ] the Minority Leader. They're both pretty good in the clinches.

turns.speaker: JEFFERSON
turns.text: Uh-huh. And where's the Press Galery?

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: Right up there over the Vice- President's chair--the four in the front row represent the four big news services. You've met the press bunch, haven't you?

turns.speaker: JEFFERSON
turns.text: Oh, yes--they're fine people--regular people.

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: Look out for those fellows--they tell the truth about you--sometimes. That corner over there is reserved for guides and sightseers who come in for five minutes to rest their feet. That section over there is reserved for Senator's friends. The front row--the empty one--is for the President and White House guests-- see that old couple over there-- they've attended every session for the last twenty years. Over the clock back here is the Diplomatic section. They and the page boys are the only real class we have in this place. The rest are mostly people who come here like they go to the zoo--

turns.speaker: JEFFERSON
turns.text: Those busts up there--all around the wall--who are they, sonny?

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: All the ex-vice-Presidents. You can get ten-to-one around here if you think you can remember their names. The Vice-President presides over the Senate--you know that. It's how he earns his pay. Oh--over there, Senator-- on the east side of the Chair we still have the old snuff boxes with real snuff in them if you like snuff.

turns.speaker: JEFFERSON
turns.text: Thanks very much, sonny--

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: I'll take your hat into the cloak room.

turns.speaker: JEFFERSON
turns.text: Here--let me give you a Boy Ranger button.

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: Swell. Thanks very much.  Good luck, Senator. Keep your left up.

turns.speaker: CHAIRMAN
turns.text: --what possible explanation can you offer for this charge being--as you say--"trumped up" against you!

turns.speaker: JEFFERSON
turns.text: It was done to stop me from talking about a section of the Appropriations Bill!

turns.speaker: CHAIRMAN
turns.text: It was?

turns.speaker: JEFFERSON
turns.text: Yes! This was how I could be put out of the Senate and out of the way! They even *promised* me that if I--

turns.speaker: CHAIRMAN
turns.text: And you say you never signed this contract with Mr. Allen?

turns.speaker: JEFFERSON
turns.text: I did not--

turns.speaker: CHAIRMAN
turns.text: You've never *seen* this contract.

turns.speaker: JEFFERSON
turns.text: Never.

turns.speaker: CHAIRMAN
turns.text: But you did *talk* to Mr. Allen about that and--?

turns.speaker: JEFFERSON
turns.text: I--I discussed it with him--yes-- because I--you see, I've always had this camp in mind--but I made no contract with him!

turns.speaker: CHAIRMAN
turns.text: Then--this is *not* you signature, Senator?

turns.speaker: JEFFERSON
turns.text: Looks like it, but--

turns.speaker: CHAIRMAN
turns.text: But it *isn't*?

turns.speaker: JEFFERSON
turns.text: It couldn't be.

turns.speaker: CHAIRMAN
turns.text: You are saying, in effect, that this is a forgery?

turns.speaker: JEFFERSON
turns.text: I'm saying I didn't sign it!

turns.speaker: COOK
turns.text: Yes, sir--big as life. Been there some time now.

turns.speaker: MCGANN
turns.text: Yes, sir.  All right, boys--let's go.

turns.speaker: COOK
turns.text: What's he bringing pigeons for?

turns.speaker: MCGANN
turns.text: What for? Why, suppose there's a storm--all lines are down--how you gonna get a message to Ma?

turns.speaker: COOK
turns.text: Positively not in the station! Gone!

turns.speaker: MCGANN
turns.text: I'll brain that guy! Well--call Paine-- call Saunders--

turns.speaker: MCGANN
turns.text: And while you're at it, get me a bed!

turns.speaker: COOK
turns.text: Let's send out a pigeon!

turns.speaker: MCGANN
turns.text: Blow a bugle!

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Sure. Sure. I'll hang a light in the steeple. One if by land--two if by sea!... Okay!  Diz--you won't believe it. Daniel Boone's *lost*!

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: How do you *like* this! You don't suppose that ranger met up with some kids--and took 'em for a hike!

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: That--or he's out blazing trails. He'll show up.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Sure--sure. He must have a compass with him.

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Getting on to dinner, isn't it, pal?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: I give that Trail Blazer five more minutes to show up--  --*five more minutes*!

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Well--who d'you take this time--Paine, Bill, Carl--or McGann?

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Hey--you're into me for a buck already. I say--McGann. Shoot the whole dollar.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Okay. For the dollar, I give you McGann *and* Bill and Carl. I got Paine.  Hello... Oh, yes.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: No, not yet, Senator Paine--not hide nor hair of the man. You mean to say the boys haven't--?

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Eight to five Little Boy Blue is plastered.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Well, why don't they try the police-- get some blood hounds--or Indian guides--

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Tell me why!

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Well, because you're doing all right at the minute.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: When Foley died, why didn't I clear out? How many times, did you hear me say I was fed up on politics and--? But *no*--I let 'em talk me into staying. Secretary to a leader of little squirts. Why? Because I need the job and a new suit of clothes.

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Would you settle for a husband?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: What's this, Diz?

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: That old standing offer from Diz Moore--Poet of Washington Correspondents.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: You know--Mrs. Diz Moore.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Oh--that again. Yeah.

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: I would cherish you--and stay sober.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Diz, you're a swell playmate--but--. Maybe if I saw you once with your hair combed, or something--or--no, no--I don't think even that would do it--

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Well, if you're sure it wouldn't--no use combing my hair for nothing.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: No--don't do it. I'm sure. The truth is, Diz--there's no man I've seen yet or--must be something wrong with me. I've been feeling low for weeks.

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: You got worms.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: What! Who?

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: You know--little worms--ambition.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Yeah. Should have seen me seven years ago--when I came to this town. *Now* what am I?--chambermaid to the Pied Piper of Jackson City; *Honorary* appointment! Scratch this thing an you'll find they wanted a dope here for two months.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: I'm still asking myself--what is he-- animal, vegetable, or mineral? A Senator! A United States Senator! I thought I'd seen everything but-- why, he doesn't know what time it is, Diz! When I think of myself sitting around--playing straight for all that phoney, patriotic chatter-- *me*, carrying bibs for an infant with little flags in his fists--no, I can't take it, Diz--I'm through--I quit!

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Sure--sure--wait a minute now--simmer down--

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Will you go chase an ambulance!

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Whadaya mean--*right*?

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Kid--wait--what do you think you're going to do?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Get my *whole* fall outfit--and quit this job in style!

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Now, you've got more sense than to put Nosey onto this guy--!

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Wait--wait. Let's see--watchdog McGann-- he's bound to move right in--get him out of the way first--  Pardon me, friend--I've got some telephoning to do--!

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Sit tight, Diz. The show commences in just a minute.

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: What show? Would you mind telling me what's coming off here?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Certainly.  Now there's the principal actor in our little play.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Ah. One of the supporting characters.

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: That gorilla in Man's clothing-- McGann.

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Oh, you mean--Puss in Boots.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Yes. Mostly "Puss."  Oh, the *other* prominent character in the play.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: The Silver Knight. Soul of Honor--on a tight-rope.

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: What do I play?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: You play--left field.

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Frankly, kid--are you goofy?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Diz--Don Quixote with bill is going to get to his feet in a minute and speak two important words--*Willet Creek*. When that happens--if my hunch is right--the Silver Knight will fall off his tightrope and Puss will jump out of his boots.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Did you like the first act?

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Yeah. What about the second act?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: That's taking place outside now.

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Well--I stuck my foot in it again at the President's press conference today--  How come so early? Get the day off?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: They decoyed the little General off to a tea party to keep him out of the Senate.

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Well, well--  Yeah--I got smart and thought I'd slip one over on the old man in the press meeting. I said, "Mr. President, about the monopoly investigation--" And he jumps right in and says, "Diz, if you were sitting in my chair, would you answer the question you're about to ask?" He had me.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: I don't mind *who* gets licked in a *fair* fight, Diz. It's these clouts below the belt I can't take. Sicking that horrible dame on him--when he's goofy about her--

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: What dame?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Paine.

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Oh--yeah--

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: He isn't going to hurt enough as it is. *She* has to twist a knife in him, too--the regal jackass! "I'll turn my glamour on him," she says--

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Forget it, kid. What's it *to* you?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Nothing. I'm just saying--I might be able to lie, cheat, steal--and I'd still tear into a guy I saw kicking a dog. Not that *he* is, by a long shot--

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Okay. So what? Stop worrying. I've told you--the dopes are gonna inherit the earth anyway--

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: I've wondered, Diz--maybe this Don Quixote's got the jump on all of us. I've wondered--maybe it's a curse to go through life wised up like you and me--

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Now, look, kid--if we're gonna wonder, let's go down and do it over a hunk of steak.  Come on, snap out of it. Diz Moore-- that rarest of companions--is here at your side.  To genteel crime, kid.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: And to Don Quixote!

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Why do I always laugh at that?

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: "There's more light here," he says--

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Drunks are funny--

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Yeah. Funny--

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Yeah. Some of my best friends are funny.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Every time I think of it, I get a laugh, Diz.

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: My friends?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Old Don Quixote--man of the people Smith--

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Waiter!

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: --followin' Miss Susan Fass-Pass around--his little heart poundin' away--the sound of angels' wings in his ears.

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Now, you've gone and let Don Quixote in here again. I told you to keep him out!

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Shut up, Diz.

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Mind, now! Keep Don Quixote out of here!

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: And I got him all dressed up, too-- to go way up in a balloon--so they can drop him a long way--make sure they break his heart. Why, not all the Boy Rangers in the world, working night shifts, 'll be able to put Humpty-Dumpty together again--

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Now--how'd Humpty-Dumpty get in here?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Do you know how I felt, Diz?

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: No. How'd you feel? Quick.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Like a mother sending her kid off to school for the first time--watchin' the little fella toddling off--in his best bib and tucker--and you sink in the middle--hoping he can stand up to the other kids--won't get his feeling hurt--and--if you could only spare him the knocks he's gotta take--  Say--who started this?

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: *I'm* just waiting for a street car--

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Well--cut it out. See? Who *cares* anyway?

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: I apologize.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: *All right*, then. After all, what's it to me? So they *drop* him out of a balloon. All I care is--I don't want to be around. See? Squeamish. See? That's what I am. No, sir. I don't have to take it. Won't be a party to no murder. I'm gonna quit. I'm through.

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Again? Good idea.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Diz--

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: How about getting married?

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Good idea. When?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Any time.

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Tonight?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Okay. You don't mind?

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: I'll cherish ya.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: You--you've been a good egg, Diz. Maybe we could clear out of this town--get to feel like *people*--get the habit of lifting up our eyes-- live like we just got out of a tunnel.

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Tunnel?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: You've never seen prairie grass with the wind leaning on it, have you, Diz?

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Is the wind tired out there?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Or angry little mountain streams-- and cattle moving against the sun. You haven't seen any of that, have you, Diz?

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Have *you*?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Do we *have* to?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: No! I can't think of anything more sappy!)

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Well, let's get going.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: We're gonna get married.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Yeah--that's right. Diz--

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: I case you don't know--I want to give ya a chance to back out if you don't like it--

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: My first name's--Clarissa.

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Yeah, I know. That's okay.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Don't say "okay," Diz. Say you think it's beautiful.

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Okay--I mean--

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: You don't know a name off-hand you like better, do you, Diz?

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: No--not offhand--

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Nothing like--uh--Susan--or anything like that, huh?

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Susan? Nah!

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: I won't take it! See? I won't be party to murder. See? Steering a poor dope up blind alleys for that grafting Taylor mob is low enough. But helping that dame cut him up in little pieces besides--nobody's gonna make me do that. No, sir.

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: You said it!

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: I'm getting out of there. Right now, Diz. Right now. Bonus or no bonus. I'm gonna clear outa that office-- everything I own--my extra hat-- everything--

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Hey! We're gettin' married--!

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Right now--everything I own--!

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Well--let's dig up the preacher, kid.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: You know, we're getting married.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Take me home, Diz.

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: He's cooked! They'll drum the poor lug out of that chamber tomorrow as sure as I'm--! And now they're all down on him. Yeah--my press pals, too--he's a bad egg--still water running deep. Boloney! It's the frame of all time! When I see a phoney like this--my journalist blood boils-- I wanna *fight*!  Look, kid--rack your brains, will you? Haven't you got any confidential stuff on that mob? I'll write my arm off--I'll blow Taylor and his--

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: I've told you ten times--if I had anything they couldn't bat down in a second, don't you suppose I'd've been up in that hearing yelling murder! Sure--he was cooked the night I sounded off like a fool and spilled the whole works!

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Then--in the name of kindness to dumb animals--we can't let him walk into that Senate tomorrow and take a terrible punch in a nose! A couple of us went up there--told him all he could do was beat it--resign--clear out. But--he's in a daze--he's been hit by a ton of bricks. Just says, "I haven't done anything. Why should I resign?" He might *listen* to *you*--

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Why me?

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Come on--don't pull that. You know you'd give your right--. What are you staying away from him for?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: You don't think he'd want *me* within fifty miles, do you?--after the exhibition he saw me give! Did you see his *face*--?

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: All I know is--he said to me tonight-- "What does your wife think?" My wife. Thinks we're married--

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Well, then, that's great! And that's a great place to leave it! It's no use *my* barging into this now and--

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: The war's on!

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: He's a house-afire!

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Diz--get what he says to the people back in that State. It's up to you and the boys. Keep those wires hot. Fire away, pal!

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Diz!

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Kid--he thinks he's talking to that mob at home, but not a line we've written--not a word he's said from that floor has gotten into that home State.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: What!

turns.speaker: DIZ
turns.text: Not a word! Taylor's sewed up every paper. They're tossing out everything that comes in over the wires!

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Freedom of the press! Mr. James Taylor blindfolding a whole State--  Wait a minute! If that's how he wants to play *I'll* get through to that bunch--I'll get plenty of words into that, State--!  Come on, Diz, get that stuff you've written--let me have it--

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: I knew it! I knew a night's rest wasn't possible in this house!  Hubert!

turns.speaker: HUBERT
turns.text: Wha--? Yes, sweetheart-- Wha--?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: That infernal phone!

turns.speaker: HUBERT
turns.text: Yes, yes--phone, phone--  A--an outrage, pet--an outrage--I'll look into this--  Hello--Joe!--What!--No! Not really! Terrible!

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: HUBERT
turns.text: Yes, Joe, yes--right away.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: HUBERT
turns.text: Sam Foley--dead!

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Great saints!

turns.speaker: HUBERT
turns.text: Of all the times! Of all the times! Two months to the end of his term-- and Foley has to go and die on us--

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Whom are you calling--in the dead of night?

turns.speaker: HUBERT
turns.text: Taylor, my dear.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Can't that wait, Hubert?

turns.speaker: HUBERT
turns.text: No, no--believe me, pet--this is *most* urgent--  Hello, hello. Is Taylor there?-- Governor Hopper. Quickly, please--

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: This isn't a home, it's the crossroads of the world!

turns.speaker: HUBERT
turns.text: Now, now, Emma, dear--you mustn't forget we have been chosen by the people of this commonwealth to--

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Save that for the laying of cornerstones, Hubert!  Oh, that morning you looked in the mirror and saw a statesman!

turns.speaker: HUBERT
turns.text: Now, pet--  Jim!

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Dinner, Hubert.

turns.speaker: HUBERT
turns.text: I'll bear that in mind... What? Oh. Dinner. Pet--my stomach couldn't hold a bird seed.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: We're waiting, Hubert.

turns.speaker: HUBERT
turns.text: Really, my dear--I don't feel like a thing.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Nonsense.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Nonsense. Why don't you listen to your children for a change? You might actually learn something?

turns.speaker: HUBERT
turns.text: For instance, how to run the affairs of government? No doubt my children could make this appointment *for* me-- with the greatest ease!

turns.speaker: HUBERT
turns.text: I do *not* want a Senator. And I do *not* want any more of this nonsense! Emma!

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Why, I think it's very sweet of the children--

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Otis!

turns.speaker: HUBERT
turns.text: That settles it! I will not be attacked and belittled by my own children in my own home! My nerves are strained to the breaking point!

turns.speaker: HUBERT
turns.text: Emma! I'm a man at the end of his rope.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: No wonder--without your dinner.

turns.speaker: HUBERT
turns.text: Emma, which is it--Horace Miller or Henry Hill?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Well, your children are very bright-- and *they* say Jefferson Smith.

turns.speaker: PAINE
turns.text: Are you ready for him, Bill?

turns.speaker: GRIFFITH
turns.text: All set. Foley's rooms in the Senate office building--nice, big clean desk--lot of Senator stationery to write his little boys on--and Foley's secretary, Saunders, to make it look like the real thing--

turns.speaker: PAINE
turns.text: Good. Are the newspaper men at the hotel?

turns.speaker: GRIFFITH
turns.text: Yup--Sweeney, Flood, Farrell--waiting for you--

turns.speaker: PAINE
turns.text: Fine. The first thing to do is-- present Mr. Smith to the press--in the *right* way. Hurry him along, Bill.

turns.speaker: GRIFFITH
turns.text: How do you feel, champ?

turns.speaker: PAINE
turns.text: All right, why?

turns.speaker: GRIFFITH
turns.text: Your name's spreading like wild-fire out here--you are the winterbook favorite to get on the National ticket.

turns.speaker: PAINE
turns.text: Oh! Go away.

turns.speaker: HUBERT
turns.text: Yes, yes--tell them I'll see them immediately--immediately!  I can't hold them off! They want something to say about this appointment. Ten to one they've got a man.

turns.speaker: MCGANN
turns.text: Relax, Happy. Jim said to wait.

turns.speaker: HUBERT
turns.text: I *can't* wait, McGann! You go into that room and tell Jim Taylor and Joe Paine that I give them *one more minute*--

turns.speaker: MCGANN
turns.text: *You* tell Jim Taylor.

turns.speaker: HUBERT
turns.text: Washington! Always discussing the problems of Washington. Nobody ever thinks of the State--and my problems!  I *will* tell Jim Taylor. It's high *time* I told him a thing or two!
